div.p: My name’s Alice Newton and I’m on the graduate fast stream. I didn’t know any
Agile before I came to the government digital service, so I’ve had a chance to
learn about Agile and how it works. For me in particular it’s meant going out into
departments where they have an idea of a product they want, rewinding them a couple of steps
and asking them to think about the user needs that they’re actually trying to serve. Then
working with them to see, building on the user needs, what would be the right product
to deliver. It’s been a good experience. A lot of people
around the departments have been quite hesitant about trying Agile as it’s something very
new to them. But I’ve universally found on my projects that afterwards, they think
it’s something they’d love to do again and they’ve been really pleased with the
outcome. Number 10 dashboard has been my biggest product
so far. It’s meant to be a dashboard to give the Prime Minister and other senior officials
the most up-to-date view on government priorities. Whether that’s housing to national business
or local growth, they should be able to open the dashboard and the Prime Minister accesses
it on his iPad. Once they’ve opened that dashboard, they’ll have access to the latest
government data and external data, as well as commentary and analysis by top analysts
in the government. When the Prime Minister opens up the dashboard,
the first thing he’ll see is a page giving him the daily political context. This has
been built with the input of the Prime Minister. I was able to meet the Prime Minister after
we’d finished the alpha version of the app and show it to him and get some direct feedback,
which was of course incredibly valuable, to be able to speak to your users. My favourite
thing that he said was that he liked it so much, he was looking forward to showing it
to Obama at the G8. I would love to tell senior civil servants
about all the opportunities that exist in digital, and how fast streamers are some of
the best people to take advantage of them, since me and the people younger than me are
probably the first generation of digital natives coming through. I’m having a lot of fun.
It’s been a brilliant first job to come into, really. It’s great to be in an organisation
where Post-Its are thrown up on the walls, everyone feels very relaxed, you’re allowed
to have ideas, you’re encouraged to have ideas. You’re working on some really important
projects for this country and, yes, just enjoying it while you do it.
